title: QA Analyst(Selenium, Cypress)
jobDescription:
Job Responsibilities:

Proven experience as a QA Analyst with a strong focus on automation. Solid knowledge and understanding of SDLC & Bug Life Cycle Management. Responsible for driving the software quality assurance lifecycle within Agile process. Designing and implementing automation test strategies. Developing and maintaining test automation frameworks. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and develop comprehensive test plans. Execute manual & automation testing, analyze results for discrepancies and defects, and meticulously document test cases based on functional specifications and user stories. Good experience in Browser Stack & Accessibility testing. Exposure in Load testing framework and capable of creating the performance test strategy. Preparing & Reviewing software bug reports and highlighting problem areas. Solid knowledge of software testing methodologies and best practices, with hands-on experience. using automation testing tools such as Selenium and Playwright. Ability to create In Sprint automation with proper coverage for sprint releases Hands on experience in automation frameworks such as TestNG, BDD. Proficiency in programming languages like Java, C#, JavaScript, Python. Experience in setting up CI/CD Pipelines for automation execution of deployments. Translate Non-functional Requirements into Performance test cases. Develops and executes Performance testing plans and scripts using JMeter. Hands on experience in API testing through different approaches like Testfully, Postman. Working experience in SAFe Agile environment. Hands on experience in Eclipse, Maven/Jenkins. Hands on experience in database testing. Extensive experience in End-to-End Automation Test Design and creation. Coordinate with Dev, PO teams and assist in RCA of defects. Knowledge of Azure Devops is a plus. Good knowledge of Web Development is a plus. Good knowledge of CI/CD with Azure DevOps is required. Excellent communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment. Exhibits strong analytical, problem solving, organizational and teaching skills. B.Tech or Bachelors Degree in a related discipline is mandatory. This is a summary of the primary accountabilities and requirements for this position. The company reserves the right to modify or amend accountabilities and requirements at anytime at its sole discretion based on business needs. Any part of this job description is subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.

title: Senior Software Engineer QA
tagsAndSkills: Automation testing,Test scripts,Javascript,Performance testing,Software development life cycle,Selenium,Test cases,JIRA
jobDescription:
Job Description
Job Description
At Agilent, we advance the quality of life by enabling scientific discovery through world-class instruments, software, and services. we're committed to innovation, collaboration, and excellence. you'll be part of a team that values creativity, continuous learning, and delivering impactful digital solutions. If you're passionate about eCommerce solutions for Cart, Checkout and much more; and want to help shape the future of online experiences, we d love to hear from you.
This role currently follows a hybrid work model. Work arrangements may evolve based on future business needs
What you'll do
  • Work with a team of engineers to deliver feature set that are crucial to Revenue growth.
  • Be a part of a world class global organization.
  • Design and develop comprehensive automation test scripts and frameworks for our constantly updating A/B testing and personalization workflows.
  • Collaborate with centralized testing team to integrate automated tests into the CI/CD pipeline.
  • Collaborate with the development team to understand product features and technical specifications to create effective test plans and strategies.
  • Perform functional, regression, and performance testing.
  • Analyze test results, identify defects, and work with developers to resolve them.
  • Mentor QA engineers to deliver better QA coverage and results.
Qualifications
Required Qualifications
  • Bachelors or Masters Degree or equivalent.
  • 8+ years of relevant experience in QA and automation dev.
  • Collaborate with the development team to understand product features and technical specifications to create effective test plans and strategies.
  • Perform functional, regression, and performance testing.
  • Analyze test results, identify defects, and work with developers to resolve them.
  • Experience writing exceptional test cases in JIRA, Cucumber etc
  • Experience with test automation frameworks like Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, or Appium.
  • Solid understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC) and QA methodologies.
  • Experience with setting up test automation with CI/CD tools (eg, Jenkins, GitLab CI).
  • Programming skills in Python, JavaScript, React, Java
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Strong communication skills and a collaborative perspective.
  • Experience in Using generative AI for test case generation and execution
Ways to stand out from the crowd
  • QA automation for testing in the eCommerce domain.
  • Test automation integration with CI/CD.
Additional Details
This job has a full time weekly schedule.
Our pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. During the hiring process, a recruiter can share more about the specific pay range for a preferred location. Pay and benefit information by country are available at: https: / / careers.agilent.com / locations
Agilent Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other protected categories under all applicable laws.
Travel Required: No
Shift: Day
Duration: No End Date
Job Function: IT

title: Senior Qa Engineer
tagsAndSkills: Cypress,Javascript,Automation Testing,Ui Automation Testing,API Testing,Quality assurance,Automation,GUI testing
jobDescription:
Job Title: Sr. QA Engineer (Javascript, Cypress, UI/API Testing)

Location: Pune/Remote

Experience Level: 5+Type: [Full-time]

US Overlap will be there


Job Description

We are looking for a detail-oriented QA Engineer to join our dynamic team. This role involves ensuring the delivery of high-quality software solutions by designing and executing effective test strategies. The ideal candidate has hands-on experience in Javascript, Cypress, and API/UI testing and is passionate about building defect-free software systems.


Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain automated test frameworks using Javascript and Cypress for web and API applications.
  • Design, write, and execute test cases and scenarios for functional, regression, performance, and scalability testing.
  • Perform API testing using tools like Postman, RestAssured, or similar libraries to ensure system integration quality.
  • Collaborate with the development and product teams to understand requirements and identify testing needs.
  • Debug issues by analyzing application logs, error messages, and stack traces.
  • Continuously improve automation frameworks for efficiency, coverage, and scalability.
  • Work closely with DevOps to integrate tests into CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins, GitHub Actions).
  • Maintain test environments, ensuring consistency and reliability across the QA lifecycle.
  • Document and communicate testing results, defect statuses, and metrics to stakeholders effectively.

Qualifications

  • Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • Experience:
  • 5+ years of experience in Quality Assurance with a focus on automation testing.
  • Strong hands-on experience in Javascript for building automated test cases.
  • Proficiency with Cypress for end-to-end web application testing.
  • Hands-on experience in API testing using tools like Postman, SoapUI, or Java-based libraries like RestAssured.
  • Technical Skills:
  • Strong understanding of HTTP, REST, and SOAP protocols.
  • Familiarity with database querying (SQL) to validate backend results.
  • Knowledge of version control tools such as Git.
  • Experience working with CI/CD pipelines.
  • Good understanding of Agile/Scrum development methodologies.
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.

Preferred Skills

  • Experience with performance testing tools like JMeter or Gatling.
  • Familiarity with containerization (e.g., Docker) and orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes).
  • Knowledge of cloud services (e.g., AWS, Azure)
